etymology.description: 疒(疒) (nì, "disease") + 尤(尤) (yóu, phonetic) = semantic 'disease' with phonetic component -> callus
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 疒(疒) (nì, "disease"), indicating a medical condition or discomfort, with 尤(尤) (yóu) for its phonetic contribution. This combination suggests a disease-related condition, specifically a callus.

examples.chinese: 长时间站立容易在脚上生出肬(肬)，引起不适(引起不適)。
examples.pinyin: Cháng shíjiān zhànlì róngyì zài jiǎo shàng shēng chū yóu, yǐnqǐ bùshì.
examples.english: Standing for long periods can easily cause calluses on the feet, leading to discomfort.

examples.chinese: 经过多次摩擦后，他的手上也出现了肬(肬)，成为劳累的标志(成為勞累的標誌)。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò duō cì mócā hòu, tā de shǒu shàng yě chūxiàn le yóu, chéngwéi láolèi de biāozhì.
examples.english: After repeated friction, calluses appeared on his hands as a sign of fatigue.

examples.chinese: 长期劳动可能导致手部出现肬(肬)。
examples.pinyin: Chángqí láodòng kěnéng dǎozhì shǒubù chūxiàn yóu.
examples.english: Long-term labor may cause calluses to form on the hands.
